Work Duration: 12 months (A 12 month employment period is registered as 3 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 12 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

NEED HELP TO RELOCATE?
If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria

details.value:
Job Overview:

This is an exciting 12 month co-op student opportunity to provide support to Kingston Midstream engineers responsible for the design and project management of capital, expense, and ARO projects relating to the upgrade, maintenance, and retirement of liquid pipelines and facilities. The co-op student will primarily focus on supporting the Operations Engineering team with the development and execution of upgrade, maintenance, retirement, electrical, and control projects.

Position Responsibilities

Support project managers with their work and complete assigned tasks which could include:

Prepare scope, designs, justification, estimates, economics, alternatives analysis, and documentation to evaluate project feasibility and to obtain approval and funding for projects
Draft regulatory applications or notifications to be submitted for regulatory approvals for projects
Prepare detailed designs, specifications, and drawing packages and have them approved by stakeholders
Prepare specifications and work with supply chain management to procure materials and services in accordance with the Company's standards, policies, and procedures
Develop and compile documents and procedures needed for the safe execution of work
Conduct field visits to conduct construction site inspections, scope projects, or assist with commissioning
Maintain project schedules, monitor cost tracking, update project forecasts and estimated in-service dates, place projects in service, and complete project status reports
Review quality control packages upon completion of construction for completion and accuracy
Research and summarize applicable codes, standards, and regulations on an assigned item
Provide technical and non-technical support on operational and engineering issues

Potential opportunities to lead projects under the direction of a project manager which could include:

Plan and implement work in accordance with the Company's HSE policies, Company engineering and construction standards, regulatory requirements, and applicable legislation
Coordinate the efforts of internal and external departments, consultants, and contractors, including those outside the incumbent's engineering discipline, to ensure that the project scope, schedule, and budget meet company objectives

Office environment with occasional day travel throughout the Kingston Midstream pipeline system.

Skills and Qualifications:

Enrolled in an Engineering program at a qualified education institution
Strong analytical, communication, interpersonal, organizational, and computer skills
Ability to work and communicate with internal and external stakeholders, including both office and field staff
Possession of a valid Class 5 driver's license and an acceptable driver's abstract is an asset
Candidates should include a copy of their university transcript with their application

Kingston Midstream is committed to providing a flexible work practice to allow office employees to work both from the office and from a remote location. This position may work remotely Mondays and Fridays and in Kingston Midstream's office Tuesday to Thursday.

We thank all interested candidates; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Application Requirements: Please upload with your resume

Resume
Cover letter
Academic Transcripts (un-official or official)
